repnme.cdata!:
Brazil - Sustainable and Equitable Growth
            Technical Assistance Program Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Sustainable and
            Equitable Growth Technical Assistance Program Project for
            Brazil were as follows: outcomes were moderately
            satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was moderate,
            the Bank performance was moderately satisfactory, and the
            Borrower performance was also moderately satisfactory. Some
            lessons learned included: an overly complex design with too
            many components and activities led to a project that was
            difficult to implement, supervise and evaluate. Also, the
            project specifically tried to address the possibility of
            change in Government priorities with flexible architecture.
            This flexibility comes with a price at the time
            of-evaluation when the original objectives had to be
            evaluated, although it was appreciated by the Government and
            matched changing conditions. The big difference between the
            first phase and the restructured phase of implementation was
            a far greater understanding of the ways the technical
            assistance loan could reinforce reform efforts supported by
            the Development Policy Loans (DPLs) and the
            government's reform agenda. This led to a greater
            buy-in and an improved rate of disbursements. By giving the
            implementing ministries and agencies more of a voice in
            choosing specific activities, there was a greater response
            and appreciation for the reforms and for project support.

Brazil - Sustainable and Equitable Growth

repnme.cdata!:
Brazil - Sustainable and Equitable Growth
            Technical Assistance Project : restructuring and extension

abstracts.cdata!:
This project paper is for the
            restructuring of the Brazil Sustainable and Equitable Growth
            Technical Assistance Project and proceeds with the amendment
            of the loan agreement entered into between the Federative
            Republic of Brazil and the International Bank for
            Reconstruction and Development dated October 4, 2005. The
            restructuring is aimed at adjusting project objectives and
            activities with the current priorities of the Borrower.
            Changes are also to strengthen project implementation
            arrangements and facilitate timely disbursement of loan
            proceeds. The restructuring changes including the following:
            (i) the inclusion of a new component on fiscal and public
            resource management; (ii) the strengthening of the financial
            component, through the inclusion of new activities to be
            developed by Comissao de Valores Mobiliarios (CVM); (iii) a
            reassignment of project implementation duties to a different
            secretariat within the Borrower's Ministry of Finance;
            (iv) eliminating a component on innovation and technology;
            and (v) a reallocation of loan proceeds among disbursement
            Categories, including the assignment of unallocated funds to
            specific activities. The Bank has extensively worked with
            the Borrower to define an updated set of activities that,
            while remaining within the original intent and scope of the
            project, will improve disbursement and better meet the
            current needs of the Government. Based on the
            Government's request and the evolving growth agenda in
            Brazil, the intermediate development objective (DO) and
            outcomes related to the science and technology component are
            dropped. Instead, a new intermediate DO is included for the
            support of the Borrower's efforts to strengthen its
            public resource management.

repnme.cdata!:
Brazil - Sustainable and Equitable Growth
            Technical Assistance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Sustainable and
            Equitable Growth Technical Assistance Project is to assist
            in preparing and implementing the next phase of the
            Government's growth program, and, consists primarily,
            of the provision of technical assistance and training
            services. The first component seeks to reduce logistics
            costs, by conducting a customs strategic plan, and plan for
            re-engineering of Customs' clearance; developing a port
            reform plan, including dock companies restructuring program,
            and the structure of regulatory accounting systems,
            implementing a highway strategic plan, and management reform
            program; an action plan to strengthen the Ministry of
            Transport's capacity, its structures and monitoring and
            evaluation systems; and, concessions evaluation. The second
            component, improving the business environment, will provide
            recommendations for improved anti-trust system processes;
            conduct an action plan for strengthening the corporate
            insolvency law framework, and, recommend improvements for
            the performance of the judicial system in resolving economic
            disputes in public and private sectors. Enhancing financial
            efficiency and depth is the third component, which will
            conduct action plans for the promotion of competitive
            structures in the banking sector, facilitate access to
            credit, developing capital markets and strengthening the
            institutional framework of the private securities authority
            - SUSEP. Component four will increase innovation capacity,
            through action plans for reform and monitoring and
            evaluation of sector funds, develop a framework for
            implementation of the Innovation Law, and, design a
            technological pilot for information technology, that
            supports social inclusion.
